title: Letter: Space jaunts for the rich come with a climate cost
text:
Stunning. Richard Branson does not own Disney World, so instead he has developed his own very expensive amusement park ride (“Branson gains a head start in space race with Bezos”, Report, FT Weekend, July 10).

What is the point of these jaunts into space but for the entertainment of some very rich passengers?

People concerned about global warming point out how aeroplanes damage the atmosphere. At least airlines provide a travel service for business or holidays.

There is no value to the passengers on Virgin Galactic flights but the pleasure of three of four minutes of zero gravity, perhaps longer than a similar experience available to riders on a rollercoaster but at far greater financial and environmental cost.

Ronald Kaiserman
Wynnewood, PA, US
